Experiment_description: The experiments involved using graph neural networks, specifically variations of the GraphSAGE encoder, to classify SPR sequences represented as small graphs. These graphs had nodes representing tokens (shape and color), connected by bidirectional edges.
Significance: These experiments are important as they explore the potential of graph neural networks in effectively classifying SPR sequences. The high CWA2 accuracies achieved indicate that graph-based models can capture complex dependencies in structured data, providing a foundation for further improvements and applications in similar domains.
Description: Each experiment converted SPR sequences into graph representations with nodes as tokens and edges connecting adjacent tokens. GraphSAGE encoders with global mean-pooling were used to generate embeddings, followed by classification through linear layers. The Complexity-Weighted Accuracy (CWA2) was a key metric across all nodes, providing a consistent measure of performance.

List_of_included_plots.description: This plot shows the training and validation loss curves over 10 epochs.
List_of_included_plots.analysis: The consistent decrease in both training and validation loss indicates effective model learning without overfitting.

List_of_included_plots.description: This plot shows the training and validation loss trends over five epochs.
List_of_included_plots.analysis: The slight increase in validation loss around epoch 3 suggests a potential risk of overfitting, requiring careful monitoring in future experiments.

List_of_included_plots.description: This plot depicts the Color-Weighted Accuracy (CWA2) on the validation set over epochs.
List_of_included_plots.analysis: The steady increase in CWA2 indicates the model's improved classification performance, showing that the graph-based approach is capturing relevant features well.

List_of_included_plots.description: This confusion matrix provides insights into the model's classification performance.
List_of_included_plots.analysis: The diagonal dominance suggests effective classification, though some misclassifications point to areas needing refinement.

Key_numerical_results.analysis: Indicates that the simple encoder with GCN layers performs well, with potential for further improvement.

Key_numerical_results.description: Validation CWA2 accuracy for Node d9995f30f62a4cf7bac3b4a616b12129.
Key_numerical_results.analysis: Demonstrates that the GraphSAGE encoder is effective, though attention is needed to prevent overfitting.
Highlights the high performance of the GraphSAGE approach, confirming its capability in handling SPR sequences.
Shows effective learning and generalization, with potential for further optimization in classification precision.
